attributes.action: Stop the scrapping of the parent governor role in schools
attributes.background: The government wants to scrap the requirement for elected parent positions on school governing bodies, in favour of them prioritising "professionals with the right skills" instead. This risks the end of parental input into their child's school and related parent-teacher collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: An "online parental forum" has been put forward under the same proposal to replace the parent positions on school governing bodies, but an online forum will not have the same impact as the physical position on the school's governing body which enables parents to have input into the school. Who are these professionals if not the teachers (with some of the right skills already), and the parents who actually know their children?

attributes.action: Link the subsidiary lights on the sides of long vehicles to the signal lights.
attributes.background: Long vehicles play a disproportionate part in injuries to cyclists. Linking the subsidiary lights already along the length of long vehicles to its signalling system would give cyclists vital seconds warning to take avoiding action, so help save their own lives instead of having to rely on drivers.
attributes.additional_details: All attempts to reduce cyclists injuries revolve around driver awareness - new cab design etc - nothing is done to improve cyclists' awareness. Often the first time cyclists realise they are in danger is when a vehicle hits them. Most drivers signal long before they turn however the signal lights are often out of the cyclists' field of view or they are distracted by hazards such as pedestrians and poor road surfaces. The line of shoulder level lights would attract the cyclists' attention.

attributes.action: Provide funding specifically to support meals on wheels services.
attributes.background: My Father is 93 and has dementia. Meals on wheels are a life-line for Him, he looks forward to them and to the people who bring them. He pays for them but they are being cut.

attributes.action: Free feminine sanitary products for all women.
attributes.background: Reports that women are using old socks as sanitary towels because they cannot afford to buy products. This could lead to serious infections and is not a situation to be tolerated in a civilised country.
attributes.additional_details:
Women do not choose to have periods. They occur as part of nature of being a woman. A period is something to be celebrated as an affirmation of the continuity of life and hope for the future.
With this in mind and to confirm the importance of women to society as the bearers of the human race amongst other things, I propose that feminine sanitary products are made available free of charge to all women through their doctors surgery.

attributes.action: Reverse the Chancellor's decision on the Housing Benefit Cap
attributes.background: Elderly people living in Extra Care Housing Schemes will not get enough housing benefit to cover their rent and service charges.  If they take up new tenancies, especially if they move to a new development the Government proposes to cap their housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
National Housing Federation
BBC
Local newspaper coverage
Local authorities
Other housing providers

attributes.action: Respond specifically to petition questions or issues
attributes.background:
A large number of petitions are met with government responses that intentionally do not address the topic or issue presented.

This tactic is frustrating and demonstrates contempt for signatories.
attributes.additional_details:
For example, in a recent petition calling for a debate between Jeremy hunt and junior doctors, the civil servants drafting the response fail to mention the very point of the petition - a debate between Hunt and doctors.

Instead we receive paragraph after paragraph of obfuscation and avoidance.

attributes.action: To allow home educated children the same services that school children have
attributes.background: Home education is entirely legal in this country yet our children are denied services such as speech/language therapy, occupational therapy and autism services.
attributes.additional_details:
My child has never attended school yet recently has displayed classic female autism symptoms.  I have had to go back and forth to my doctor for a year to even get referred to a peadiatrican and have been told that if i want access to services i should simply put her in school.  

Also Autism diagnosis is different from hospital to hospital and should have the same diagnosis criteria yet i know families who have been battling for years but i also know families who have been diagnosed after just one meeting even though this is against guidelines

attributes.action: Stop private companies offering NHS services from using the NHS logo.
attributes.background:
Private companies such as Serco, Circle, Virgin and others deliver NHS services using the NHS name and logo.

The public does not want the NHS privatised and most people have no idea that they are being treated by the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS logo is a tried and trusted brand. If private companies give poor care while operating under the NHS brand, the NHS is likely to get the blame

It is important that users of healthcare services know who is providing the care they are getting.

attributes.action: Stop David Cameron agreeing to draft EU deal and go back to the table again
attributes.background: David Cameron draft EU referendum proposal is far short of what the vast British public expect of him
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron needs to honour his original pledges and not these draft proposals which he is now currently in favour off eg a benefits brake controlled by the EU is like having no Brake on benefits

attributes.action: Investigate the appalling service provided by Southern Rail during 2016
attributes.background: This year many trains have been cancelled by this company outside of industrial action. The company have cited staff shortages. But this is happening every day of every week. Surely their planning &/or HR department should & could have seen this coming.
attributes.additional_details: Only today two trains have been cancelled on the southern network. The 08:09 Southampton central & 08:30 Chichester. Many people rely on these services including school children who may be left venerable waiting on platforms when their parents are expecting them at a different time. This is a shocking service and needs to be resolved.

attributes.action: All healthcare staff to be trained on treating those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: My husband suffers with PTSD and some mental health issues. Since his diagnosis we have struggled to get him the help he needs. This has been exasperated by GPs, their staff and other healthcare providers being unprofessional, unsympathetic or even understanding of their patient.
attributes.additional_details:
In my capacity with support groups and organisations, I have heard various similar experiences. Patients being told that because they aren't suicidal that minute, they can't be seen because staff are too "busy", patients being refused medication, being told they don't have the "correct" symptoms, being told they are "making it up". 
If the people you are supposed to turn to when we need help the most don't treat us with dignity and respect, what hope is there?

attributes.action: Stop The TV licence by Privatising the BBC.
attributes.background:
Stop the TV licence as it's immoral and not wanted by the majority of the public, is a biased organisation and it should not be compulsory to have a TV licence.
Taxing citizens to subsidise a biased broadcasting corporation is unfair and it shouldn't be allowed to happen!
attributes.additional_details:
In the digital age we live in, the BBC should be able to survive on advertisements and selling the rights to its various TV programs and even to charge a subscription if they wish to. ITV and Channels 4 and 5 survive without any contribution from a TV license Why Should the BBC be any different. 
It is time to stop charging this unfair tax which is punitive to those on lower incomes and not supported by the majority of the public.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the matter of forcing schools to convert to academies
attributes.background: We were told Academy schools gave parents a choice from the mainstream, local authority system. Forcing all schools to become academies will deprive parents of ANY choice. This proposal was not in the Conservative manifesto in 2015, thus the government should not commit schools to this change.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no evidence that a universal academy system will work. Ofsted's Chief Inspector Sir Michael Wilshaw highlighted serious weaknesses at seven multi-academy trusts. He was also scathing about the level of pay given to the senior management in academies, with one head teacher earning £225,000 a year, more than the prime minister earns. Ref: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35775458

If the Conservatives want to commit the education of our children to Academies then there should be a national debate and a referendum to make such an enormous change.

attributes.action: To remove the distinction between killing someone whilst driving & murder.
attributes.background:
Under UK law death by dangerous driving has a maximum gaol sentence of 14 years (CPS website) 
We the undersigned think this maximum tariff should be removed and a sentence of "Life" introduced (as if death was caused by any other way) 
This is especially true when driver is disqualified or unfit
attributes.additional_details:
CPS info on death by dangerous driving. 
http://www.cps.gov.uk/legal/s_to_u/sentencing_manual/death_by_dangerous_driving/

attributes.action: To apply CCTV in to the family courts.
attributes.background: To end the corruption in family courts, proceedings should be recorded. These recordings could be passed onto the police to enable them to investigate if allegations of lying under oath are made.
attributes.additional_details: By adding CCTV to prevent social workers, judges and parents from lying or turn them away from the idea of lying under oath.

attributes.action: Cancel the court closures announced on 11th February, 2016 and improve justice.
attributes.background: There are currently 460 courts and tribunals in E & W.  The govt. announced the closure of 86 of these, claiming they are substantially under used. Why not ensure that they are used more often - speeding up justice. It claims that they will be within a 1 hour car journey, ignores public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Govt. claims that the 86 courts are under used by 60%. This could be addressed by ensuring that matters are listed more quickly and the courts used more effectively. The Govt. claims that 97% of citizens will still be able to reach a court, by car, within an hour, ignoring those without cars. There are examples of round trips that will be costly and exceed four hours. This will stop justice being local and accessible.

attributes.action: Raise the age children have to claim adult pip from 16 to 18
attributes.background: The law states that people are legally adult at 18, however children aged 16 have to claim adult disability benefits instead of childrens, despite not legally classed as an adult. I want the age of which an adult claim are made for PIP to be raised to 18, when you are legally classed as an adult
attributes.additional_details: Help allow 16 and 17 years olds get the help they need financially when disabled, instead of being penalised under an adult claim.

attributes.action: National Safety Campaign to Raise Awareness of the Dangers of Distracted Driving
attributes.background:
The most recent awareness campaign was in 2012; since then the role of devices in our lives has hugely increased.

We believe a national safety campaign should be created that clearly and memorably restates the law and highlights the dangers and impact of using a hand-held device when driving.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst it has been illegal to use a handheld mobile phone when driving since 2003, there is significant research that shows motorists continue to use their devices incorrectly:

- 95% of motorists stated that they regularly see other drivers looking at their phones in stationary traffic 

- DoT figures show that motorists using their phones were involved in 3,611 crashes between 2009 and 2014. 

- 1 in 5 UK motorists admit accessing social networking sites on their mobile phone while driving.

attributes.action: Discuss a possible free trade area with the rest of the Commonwealth of Nations.
attributes.background:
We, the British people, will vote on the 23rd of June whether we leave the EU or remain.
In order to silence fear-mongering, we need a plan.
How about the Commonwealth of Nations, our friends that we turned our backs on 41 years ago in favour of signing up, unknowingly, for an EU straightjacket.
attributes.additional_details:
A free trade area between the 53 states of the Commonwealth of Nations would be within the interests of the British economy.
13 of these countries are among the fastest growing in the world.
“The Commonwealth is the ideal platform for business and trade… I hope that India’s ties with the Commonwealth will move from strength to strength, and that the new paradigm will only mean greater warmth, greater co-operation.” Kamal Nath, Former Indian Development Minister
The Commonwealth is the future.

attributes.action: Prevent the UK government from introducing new licensing laws for air guns.
attributes.background:
Airguns already require licences when they are above a certain power yet new laws have been proposed to apply license requirements for ALL air guns. 

Airguns are important for pest and vermin control and are a fun hobby for many people across the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 4,203 recorded crimes in which air weapons were used during 2010/11, a fall of 15% compared with the previous year and 70% below the peak recorded in 2002/03.

In England and Wales firearms were reportedly used in 11,227 offences, 0.3% of all recorded crimes.

In England and Wales there were 388 firearm offences in which there was a fatal or serious injury, 13% lower than in 2009/10. In almost 80% of firearms offences no injury occurred.

www.parliament.uk/briefing-papers/sn01940.pdf

attributes.action: Increased support and help for early development eating disorders.
attributes.background: Many people in the early stages of eating disorders are left for it to get worse before they can get treatment. It should be dealt with then so that the recovery process will be faster.

attributes.action: Have a referendum to increase tax/create a new NHS tax, to fund and save the NHS
attributes.background:
The NHS is a cherished institution. In recent years it's faced huge pressures due to rising demand and an ageing population in the face of falling budgets.

As a country, we need to decide if we want to fund the NHS by increasing tax/creating a new NHS tax or co-pay/switch to an insurance model.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is at breaking point. Funding per capita is falling in the face of rising demand, fewer beds, staff vacancies and dwindling morale. We spend less as a % of GDP than most rich countries despite having some of the best healthcare outcomes.

Whilst some efficiency savings are needed, the NHS is crying out for more money. That's why we need a referendum about its funding so YOU, the people who pay for and use the service, can decide what you want in the future.

Refs: http://bit.ly/1P2AnLg

attributes.action: Start issuing on the spot fines for foreign drivers breaking UK driving laws
attributes.background: Foreign truck drivers speeding, overtaking in the third lane of the motorway and parking on hard shoulders and clearways
attributes.additional_details: A system should be employed whereby offending drivers are stopped at the point of exiting the UK, using the numerous cameras that already exist in the UK, and fined for offences committed on our roads

attributes.action: Major planning proposals/applications part of conveyancing searches.
attributes.background: To ensure any major planning proposals/applications show up in searches carried out by solicitors in conveyancing matters, enabling potential buyers to be aware of how their home/land/business may be affected in the future.
attributes.additional_details: The people of Gravesham and Thurrock have recently entered into the first consultation phase of a major new roadworks connecting Kent to Essex.  The consultation phase is short, therefore not giving residents opposed to the new infrastructure time to get opposing arguments together.  Thurrock is already one the most polluted boroughs in the UK.  Some residents have already been pre-warned their properties/land may be subject to CPOs and others will be left looking at 'spaghetti junction'.

attributes.action: To make HMRC specifically the Tax Credits department have accessible e-mails.
attributes.background:
To make HMRC specifically the Tax Credits department, more effective in dealing with customers. 
To have specific email accounts, that deal with the different areas of Tax Credits claim ie: Change of circumstances, Complaints, and Compliance.
attributes.additional_details:
This allows the claimant to keep track of their documents that they send in, making postal loss virtually impossible, gives the claimant more peace of mind, show's that the email has been received, by the time scale given. 
All other benefit departments have this facility, the HMRC should give this to their customers too. Phone calls are expensive, rarely answered, and once answered, invariably the call handler will be confronted with a frustrated claimant, ending in the call be disconnected.

attributes.action: Make audio-visual announcements be included in the government's new 'Buses Bill'
attributes.background: If the government are reviewing the overall regulation of the industry then it would be a suitable time to ensure that bus networks are fully accessible. Audio-visual technology speaks and displays next and final stop information, assisting those visually impaired to use the bus with confidence.
attributes.additional_details:
I am petitioning as I would like to see the government's new bill include a requirement for ‘Talking Buses’. These are buses which include on board audio-visual (A/V) next stop and final destination announcements, as well as other important information regarding the service. This vital assistive technology enables people who are blind or visually impaired to get the bus independently and with confidence.

This technology is a rarity outside London, and that needs to change!

attributes.action: Amend guidelines: Smear tests for all sexually active females across UK.
attributes.background:
Women under 25 in Britain (excluding Scotland) are subjected to guidelines which limited their ability to receive smear tests at first request despite showing symptoms

A petition on this issue in 2015 reached over 300,000 signature, but those we elected to voice our opinions denied our request.
attributes.additional_details:
You can read the governments response to the petition of 2015 here: https://petition.parliament.uk/archived/petitions/62385

We may only account for 2% of 2011's cervical cancer diagnosis, but our health matter just as much as those 25+ females. 

We should not have to fight for our right to tests which can save women. We should aid in the prevention of invasive cervical cancer before our sisters & friends have to make the decision between a Hysterectomy or a Cone Biopsy.

attributes.action: Protect public libraries with ring-fenced budgets devolved to local authorities.
attributes.background: Since 2010, Government cuts to council budgets have resulted in huge cuts to public services.  Public libraries across England have been hit hard with libraries closing, opening hours slashed and qualified librarians being replaced with volunteers .  Libraries are not a luxury, they are a necessity.

attributes.action: Back Future Doctors - Tuition Fee Loans for graduates on 5 year medicine courses
attributes.background: With the GEM (four year) degree programmes gradually being phased out, & competition for places at an all time high, graduates are turning to the 5 year courses. These 5 year courses are extremely costly (£9,000) with no finance support until the fifth year & may only be available for the richest.

attributes.action: Make university free for all people.
attributes.background: All people should have the right to higher education, without having to worry about how they will pay off the £9000 per year (which is set to rise in 2017/18). This is wrong, because some people, of poorer backgrounds, will struggle to pay and therefore be put off university.

attributes.action: Make learning about FGM part of the curriculum
attributes.background: FGM happens from birth to adolescent it happens all over the world . Even thought It's illegal in the uk it's still practised. Raising awareness of FGM will help people understand the issues it makes girls everywhere face and enable people to comprehend that it's a violation of human rights.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: Make the provision of free public toilets a legal requirement for local councils
attributes.background: Public toilets are not legally require to be provided by local authorities, which means that they are often closed to save money. As urinating or defecating on the street is illegal it effectively means that a person has to spend money in a private establishment in order to use the toilets.
attributes.additional_details:
"Joan Dean said her husband Brian, who has Parkinson's Disease, was left humiliated when he wet himself after failing to find a toilet on a trip to Levenshulme, in Manchester, where 18 toilets have been closed in the last 10 years."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36405414

People who are vulnerable, ill, homeless or on low income might not be able to use private facilities yet face legal action if they urinate or defecate on the street. This is an affront to dignity and needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Make election manifestos a legal and binding contractual document
attributes.background: The voter bases their decision on who to vote for in local & general elections, on their promises made within election manifestos. We seek a law BEFORE the 2020 election, the make these manifestos, legally binding documents which must be adhered to within 12 months of election, or face prosecution
attributes.additional_details: If any government is voted in and does not fulfill their manifesto promises without good and legal reason within their first 12 months in office, they shall face prosecution under fraud law, and must immediately dissolve their government.

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK & make Prescriptions Free for all.
attributes.background: These costs apply only to England as prescription charges have been abolished in the rest of the UK. In Wales, prescriptions have been free for everyone since 2007, Northern Ireland scrapped the charges in 2010 and Scotland followed suit in 2011, Workers in England feel they are being Penalised.

attributes.action: Make local councils responsible for the law on cannabis in their area.
attributes.background: The government has decided that a nationwide legalisation of cannabis is not on the cards, so perhaps a council by council ruling (bylaws) could be an alternative. A more democratic way that would allow the trialling of a regulated market in small areas first.
attributes.additional_details: A similar model has worked exceptionally well in the US, so why not learn from their successes and follow suit? Let the people decide what's right for them.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that cabinet MPs have appropriate qualifications
attributes.background: The recent strike by junior doctors has highlighted the gap of understanding between members of the cabinet and the fields they are expected to work in. If we are to have confidence in the abilities of our cabinet, regardless of their party, they need to be properly qualified in their fields.
attributes.additional_details: During the last parliament George Osborne embarrassed himself by confusing the deficit and the debt in a public statement. He does not have economic qualifications was obviously ill-prepared for the role of chancellor. Jeremy Hunt caused outrage and triggered the junior doctor strike by trying to force a new contract based on ill-informed conclusions, and Micheal Gove cause chaos in higher education over fees. If each office had appropriate qualifications such issues could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Extend the "Help to Buy: Mortgage Guarantee" scheme until at least December 2017
attributes.background: The governments "Help to Buy: Mortgage Guarantee" scheme is due to end in December 2016. This allows buyers (not just 1st time) to put down a 5% deposit with the next 20% of the mortgage guaranteed by the government; this give lenders additional security against people defaulting on their mortgage.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the start of the scheme around 73,726 houses have been purchased with support from the scheme; of which 79% have been first time buyers. (Stats from www.gov.uk)

Extending this scheme would allow thousands more people the opportunity to purchase their first house in times when getting a large lump sum of cash for a deposit over 5% can be extremely difficult.

Additional information about how the scheme works can be seen here:
www.helptobuy.gov.uk/mortgage-guarantee/how-does-it-work/

attributes.action: Stop using schools as polling stations
attributes.background: Thousands of schools close during elections for use as polling stations.  This is extremely disruptive to children's education and costs parents in terms of lost earnings, annual leave or childcare.  Schools are seen as the easy option, when alternative facilities could be made available.
attributes.additional_details: Every year schools are closed to be used as polling stations during local elections, general elections and referendums, causing disruption to education and cost to parents. Given that the government has placed such high importance on school attendance (fining parents £60 for a day missed) it is hypocritical closing schools to save money during elections, particularly when the cost falls on parents. Schools cannot remain open with the general public on the premises so alternatives should be found

attributes.action: Increase the rate of pay for NHS Nurses.
attributes.background: Working in immensely stressful conditions and unsocial hours, nurses pay needs to reflect this. Working as a nurse carries great responsibility and provides a valuable service within health care which needs to be recognised.

attributes.action: Offer all new parents the chance to learn lifesaving baby CPR
attributes.background:
In an unresponsive child, the first few minutes of first aid that is administered can be the difference between life & death.
If parents were given the opportunity to learn lifesaving CPR skills, more infant deaths could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently attended a first aid course. To see someone preform CPR on a small, lifeless baby (in this case it was just a training doll) hit me hard. I have three children. My youngest is just under a year old. And in an emergency, before that day, I wouldn't have known what to do. 
The skills I learnt that day made me realise all new parents should be offered basic training as part of the many after care checks taken by health professionals. One day, that parent may end up having to use it.

attributes.action: Stop Our Dad Being Deported In 24hours!Theresa May please dont' break my family
attributes.background: My father is being deported within 24 hours,he will leave his 4 daugthers and wife,the youngest is 3 years old.It is tearing my family. He has done everything to make things right & support us.Please dont let them destroy our family. My dad is a good person,every family deserves to be together
attributes.additional_details: Immigration does not care about family rights any more they have abolished this and we did appeal under these grounds.They say that my sisters and go and visit in the holidays.I cannot bear to see my sisters and mother suffer any longer please I urge you to please sign this petition and stop my  dad from leaving.I plea to all of you to please not to destroy my family.We have all been here for 22 years and they could give my dad a chance to be with his family.They are taking our dad away from us

attributes.action: Compulsory blood test for anyone taken to hospital for suspected drug spiking
attributes.background: My daughter recently had her drink spiked, she was taken to hospital by ambulance and escorted by police, she was in a bad way but never got a blood test as a&e was busy, the police could not bring criminal charges against the person responsible as there was no evidence without a  blood test
attributes.additional_details: My daughter and others before her have unknowingly through spiking taken drugs which have had a traumatic and sometimes fatal consequences. Efforts should be made to stop or deter perpitraitors from committing this act. Police stated that a blood test would have confirmed what she had in her system and there fore charge the person with grevious bodily harm. drug spiking is a serious issue and is increasingly being used as a tool to incapacitate victims for rape or other hideous crimes.

attributes.action: Secure the UK's membership of the European Single Market as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum on the UK's membership of the EU this petition calls on the new government to do everything within its means to secure the UK's membership of the Single Market as soon as possible. This will save jobs, economic growth and indirectly funding for public services.
attributes.additional_details: Recent turmoil in the financial markets and the precipitous decline in the value of sterling have demonstrated the importance of economic certainty and the UK's membership of the Single Market. The EU is the UK's most important trading partner. Securing tariff-free access to imports and exports of goods and services is critical to UK economic growth, jobs and public services.

attributes.action: Full HMRC investigation into the  Panama Papers
attributes.background:
It has recently come to light through an industrial scale leak, namely the Panama Papers, that some UK individuals and businesses may have profited through tax avoidance overseas via shell companies. 
 
It is only right a full investigation by HMRC is conducted.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in Stephen Crabb
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, strongly disapprove of the way that Stephen Crabb has been operating in his role as the Work and Pensions Secretary. Parliament should debate a motion of no confidence in him immediately.

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags altogether and enforce environmentally responsible bags.
attributes.background: U.K. government has decided that plastic bags are to be reduced due to the environmental harm they cause. If they are so awful why not rid them entirely and instead have paper and other such bags so that members of the public are not juggling their shopping in an effort to protect the environment.

attributes.action: Consider amending the Revenge Porn law to make it apply retrospectively.
attributes.background: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill (HL Bill 49), Section 33 now makes Revenge Porn - the act of "disclosing private sexual photographs and films with intent to cause distress" - a criminal offence. However, actions committed before the passing of this law are not considered a crime.
attributes.additional_details: Just because the act of "disclosing private sexual photographs and films with intent to cause distress" was recognised as a crime in 2015, it does not mean that it has not occurred for many years. Victims of this crime cannot gain justice for incidents in the past. This petition is asking Parliament to consider amending the law and allowing it to become Ex Post Facto - meaning that past actions can retrospectively be declared as a 'crime' in the eyes of the law.

attributes.action: Change the date of the EU Referendum date so it won't clash with other events.
attributes.background: The Referendum on June 23rd clashes with many events Glastonbury, Exams, Euro 2016 ect therefore the campaign will be overshadowed by non political events this will prevent voters from fully engaging in the Referendum. After May elections public mood for the voting will be significantly reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendum date June 23rd 

Exams GCSE and Alevel June 23rd 

Euro Football Tournament  June 10th - July 10th 

5th May Elections;

Police Crime Commissioner 
Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales Assembly 
London Mayor 
London Assembly 
English local Government

Election dates - http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/find-information-by-subject/elections-and-referendums/upcoming-elections-and-referendums

attributes.action: Make it illegal for automatic service charges to be added onto restaurant bills.
attributes.background: Paying a tip to a waiter or restaurant should be completely discretionary and not be automatically added onto a bill. Restaurant diners should pay a tip on their own accord and not have to physically ask for it to be removed.
